suppress.notes: The CVE-2018-1258 and CVE-2021-22112 occurs from spring security libraries, despite the latest versions are used. This is confirmed as false positive and hence it is suppressed (https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/2952)
False positive reported at https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/1658. The Build fails with newer versions of the library

This CVE is related to file type tag parsing. However, the associated CVE seems to be a false positive on the lang-tag jar. (https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/3043). The CVE occurs in the newer version.
CVE-2021-28170 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-28170 Spring Framework vulnerability, subject to review after Spring Boot upgrade to 2.4.x affected lib org.glassfish:jakarta.el:3.0.3

A vulnerability in all versions of Nim-lang allows unauthenticated attackers to write files to arbitrary directories via a crafted zip file with dot-slash characters included in the name of the crafted file
Major liquibase update to version 4.8.0+ needed, this will require code refactoring
jackson-databind issue, upgrading to new version broke functional tests.
org.apache.poi issue, upgrading to new version and a large depth of nested objects
spring boot issue, upgrading to new version broke functional tests.
Spring Framework older unsupported versions, it is possible for a user to provide a specially crafted SpEL expression that may cause a denial of service condition
In Spring Framework versions 5.3.0 - 5.3.16 and older unsupported versions, it is possible for a user to provide a specially crafted SpEL expression that may cause a denial of service condition.

In Spring Framework versions 5.3.0 - 5.3.18, 5.2.0 - 5.2.20, and older unsupported versions, the patterns for disallowedFields on a DataBinder are case sensitive which means a field is not effectively protected unless it is listed with both upper and lower case for the first character of the field, including upper and lower case for the first character of all nested fields within the property path.
